data.text: The IMF has reached a staff-level agreement with Mozambique on a $470 million program to support sustainable growth and long-term stability. Read more here: https://t.co/Q3gKvBScPU #IMFAfrica https://t.co/ZlHGoAySiV

Should the rich pay more taxes than the poor? @imf_podcast talks to IMF's @PaoloMauroEcon. 

🎧 Listen here: https://t.co/kiwIKFsbvj

Shipping rates soared during the pandemic, and now those costs are likely to fuel additional inflation pressure through the end of this year. See our new #IMFBlog for more. https://t.co/zlFdfukYpR https://t.co/QznQocIhpw

Korea has recovered impressively from the pandemic thanks to proactive policy support. However, global uncertainties pose elevated risks to the outlook, but Korea has ample space to respond with more support if needed. Our latest economic assessment: https://t.co/XRV7jV6LTM https://t.co/9sROF8dtfc

Trouble travels. And countries need to consider the serious risk of civil unrest if we fail to cooperate and coordinate action to protect the global economy. @DohaForum @KGeorgieva @MoF_Qatar https://t.co/HyfAm4Rt7w

The inflationary impact of higher shipping costs is poised to keep building through the end of this year, adding to faster price increases for many countries. See #IMFBlog for more. https://t.co/AT2mM7WGGS https://t.co/tlVWbp7wPJ
At the 2022 @DohaForum, IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva told CNN’s @EleniGiokos that the IMF has an important role to play in responding to the war in Ukraine. Here’s why: https://t.co/f0tazkmJ5U

Only a small fraction of vaccines used in Africa are actually made in Africa. IMF emergency financing is helping countries free up resources to fund innovation & research. Learn more: https://t.co/W5pT5o6WeO #IMFAfrica https://t.co/NCHyhlm8yz

Increasingly more #G20 countries are trying to bring a gender perspective to the budget preparation process but just one third carry out gender assessments up front to understand the potential impact of new policies on gender equality.

Beyond the humanitarian crisis of the war in Ukraine 🇺🇦, all the world’s regions will experience slower growth and faster inflation. The IMF Executive Board has concluded the first and second reviews under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) for Costa Rica 🇨🇷. The country’s economic program is promoting a more sustainable, green, and inclusive economy.  https://t.co/jMeT1PgeEf https://t.co/hTFpqm1Ifk

The 30-month arrangement provides 🇦🇷 with financial support backed by policies to strengthen debt sustainability, start to tackle high inflation, boost reserves, and promote inclusive growth. https://t.co/ao23B56uZp
The IMF Executive Board has approved $44bn to #Argentina under the Extended Fund Facility, which allows for an immediate disbursement of around $9.656bn. https://t.co/LAT2eG1Hc4

It is urgent for Sri Lanka to implement a credible & coherent strategy to restore macroeconomic stability and debt sustainability, while protecting vulnerable groups and reducing poverty through targeted social safety nets. Read our latest economic report: https://t.co/DBXYw02V49 https://t.co/ff47eRf8Lu

Foreign direct investments channeled through resident Special Purpose Entities are remarkably high in some economies—in Luxembourg, they are 45 times the size of its economy, it’s 30 times in Mauritius, and 28 times in Bermuda. #IMFBlog https://t.co/RpaYxg6A1x https://t.co/IW4B14YNDy

@IMFLive @KGeorgieva And of course, we know that the peace dividend that we had since the end of the Cold War that led to improvement in the standard of living, may be at risk. https://t.co/cwiSI0HB9Q
